_openstack_stack_update_with_identity_api_v3: openstack stack update ---------------------- .. code-block:: console usage: openstack --os-identity-api-version 3 stack update [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--noindent] [--prefix PREFIX] [-t <template>] [-e <environment>] [--pre-update <resource>] [--timeout <timeout>] [--rollback <value>] [--dry-run] [--parameter <key=value>] [--parameter-file <key=file>] [--existing] [--clear-parameter <parameter>] [--tags <tag1,tag2...>] [--wait] <stack> Update a stack. **Positional arguments:** ``<stack>`` Name or ID of stack to update **Optional arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit ``-t <template>, --template <template>`` Path to the template ``-e <environment>, --environment <environment>`` Path to the environment. Can be specified multiple times ``--pre-update <resource>`` Name of a resource to set a pre-update hook to. Resources in nested stacks can be set using slash as a separator: nested_stack/another/my_resource. You can use wildcards to match multiple stacks or resources: nested_stack/an\*/\*_resource. This can be specified multiple times ``--timeout <timeout>`` Stack update timeout in minutes ``--rollback <value>`` Set rollback on update failure. Value "enabled" sets rollback to enabled. Value "disabled" sets rollback to disabled. Value "keep" uses the value of existing stack to be updated (default) ``--dry-run`` Do not actually perform the stack update, but show what would be changed ``--parameter <key=value>`` Parameter values used to create the stack. This can be specified multiple times ``--parameter-file <key=file>`` Parameter values from file used to create the stack. This can be specified multiple times. Parameter value would be the content of the file ``--existing`` Re-use the template, parameters and environment of the current stack. If the template argument is omitted then the existing template is used. If no :option:`--environment` is specified then the existing environment is used. Parameters specified in :option:`--parameter` will patch over the existing values in the current stack. Parameters omitted will keep the existing values ``--clear-parameter <parameter>`` Remove the parameters from the set of parameters of current stack for the stack-update. The default value in the template will be used. This can be specified multiple times ``--tags <tag1,tag2...>`` An updated list of tags to associate with the stack ``--wait`` Wait until stack goes to UPDATE_COMPLETE or UPDATE_FAILED .. arguments:** ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit ``--project <project>`` Filter users by <project> (name or ID)

User's password With v2password: Password to use With v3password: User's password With v3oidcpassword: Password With v3unscopedadfs: Password With password: User's password With v3unscopedsaml: Password (Env: OS_PASSWORD) With token_endpoint: The endpoint that will always be used With admin_token: The endpoint that will always be used (Env: OS_ENDPOINT) With token_endpoint: The token that will always be used With token_endpoint: Authentication token to use with With v3token: Token to authenticate with (Env: With osc_password: Project ID to scope to With v3password: Project ID to scope to With v3scopedsaml: Project ID to scope to With v3oidcpassword: Project ID to scope to With v3unscopedadfs: Project ID to scope to With token: Project ID to scope to With v3token: Project ID to scope to With password: Project ID to scope to With v3unscopedsaml: Project ID to scope to (Env: OS_PROJECT_ID)``--os-policy-api-version <policy-api-version>`` Policy API version, default=1 (Env: (diff) ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ You can select the Identity API version to use by adding the :option:`--os-identity-api-version` parameter or by setting the corresponding environment variable: .. code-block:: console export OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION=3 This section documents only the difference in subcommands available for the openstack client when the Identity API version is changed from v2 to v3. .. _openstack_access_token_create_with_identity_api_v3: openstack access token create (Identity API v3) ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ .. code-block:: console usage: openstack --os-auth-type token --os-identity-api-version 3 access token create [-h] [-f {html,json,json,shell,table,value,yaml,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--noindent] [--prefix PREFIX] --consumer-key <consumer-key> --consumer-secret <consumer-secret> --request-key <request-key> --request-secret <request-secret> --verifier <verifier> Create an access token Optional arguments ------------------ ``-h, --help`` show this help message and exit ``--consumer-key <consumer-key>`` Consumer key (required) ``--consumer-secret <consumer-secret>`` Consumer secret (required) ``--request-key <request-key>`` Request token to exchange for access token (required) ``--request-secret <request-secret>`` Secret associated with <request-key> (required) ``--verifier <verifier>`` Verifier associated with <request-key> (required) .. _openstack_consumer_create_with_identity_api_v3: openstack consumer create (Identity API v3) subject: run swift blocks if any services are enabled
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-25 18:37:35.000000000', 'files': ['stack.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/3cff013d8e425ce9210586497be6305d49227218', 'message': 'run swift blocks if any services are enabled

Previously the swift blocks only ran if s-proxy is enabled, which
prevents a multinode configuration. We should run these blocks if any
swift services are enabled, and push proxy specific conditionals one
step lower.

Change-Id: I540a97615b3c19f882c8673b1a4a29cd47e36aa8
'}]
commit_message:
run swift blocks if any services are enabled

Previously the swift blocks only ran if s-proxy is enabled, which
prevents a multinode configuration. We should run these blocks if any
swift services are enabled, and push proxy specific conditionals one
step lower.

Change-Id: I540a97615b3c19f882c8673b1a4a29cd47e36aa8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/05/297805/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if is_service_enabled swift; thenif is_service_enabled swift; thenif is_service_enabled swift; then
deleted_lines: if is_service_enabled s-proxy; thenif is_service_enabled s-proxy; thenif is_service_enabled s-proxy; then

commit_message:
Add 'reset-state' to update server status in database

Support 'reset-state' in trove API and troveclient to make it
possible to update server status manually.

Implements: blueprint reset-server-state

Change-Id: Iea52438ed9a5ad113a27e65f33a550422d313b82
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove-specs refs/changes/97/268897/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ====================== Server State Reset API ====================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/trove/+spec/reset-server-state Provide an API to to reset the state of a server being stucked in building. Problem description =================== When we use trove to boot a server, it will start an instance with a state 'BUILD' waiting for heartbeat from trove-guestagent to update its status. But in some cases, trove-conductor will not update the state due to network problem or database down or rabbitmq down, etc.. When the state stucked in 'BUILD', we can not delete the server through trove API and that may also effect tenant quota usage. This bp aim to solve this by calling reset state API. Use Cases ========= Proposed change =============== A new API function and corresponding trove command will be added to reset the status of instances. The initial proposal is to provide a method for administrator to handle the trove instance item stucked in status building. Alternatives ------------ Login in the trove database, use the following update sql to change the trove instances item. :: update instances set server_status='some status' where id='xxx-xxx-xxx-xxx'; Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- Add a new REST API to reset trove instance states: * POST /v1.0/{accountId}/instances/{instanceId}/action JSON request schema definition:: 'os-reset_status': { 'status': 'ACTIVE' } Normal http response code: 202 Expected error http response code: 400 Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- A new command, reset-state, will be added to python-troveclient. This command mirrors the underlying API function. Resetting the status of a trove instance can be performed by: $ trove reset-state <instance> --active Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Chaozhe Chen(ccz) <chaozhe.chen@easystack.cn> Work Items ---------- * Implement REST API * Implement trove client functions * Implement trove command Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= None Documentation Impact ==================== The trove client documentation will need to be updated to reflect the new command. The trove API documentation will need to be updated to reflect the REST API changes. References ========== None

DevStack script: better commenting of supported env. variables

Change-Id: Ibd714e71e219949740c4b1c104ebf01780ba2cf7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-calico refs/changes/35/297935/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This script can be used to bootstrap a single or multi-node Calico/DevStack # cluster. Please note that it has not been exhaustively reviewed or tested # for safety, and is designed for use on a fresh Ubuntu Trusty VM, with no data # that you would care about losing. We recommend that you review the following # code, before running the script.# SERVICE_HOST# If the SERVICE_HOST environment variable is already set when ./stack.sh # is run, and is _different_ from the local machine's hostname, the # networking-calico DevStack plugin will interpret that as a request to set # up a compute-only node, that points to $SERVICE_HOST as its controller.# On the other hand, if SERVICE_HOST is not set, or is the _same_ as the # local hostname, the plugin will set up a combined controller and compute # node.# Therefore, to bring up a multi-node Calico/DevStack cluster, set and # export SERVICE_HOST in the environment, to the hostname for the chosen # controller node in your cluster, before invoking this script. # # For a single node Calico/DevStack cluster, the environment should leave # SERVICE_HOST unset. # # TEST_GERRIT_CHANGE # # By default this script uses the master branch of networking-calico. To # test a networking-calico change in Gerrit that hasn't yet been merged to # master, set the TEST_GERRIT_CHANGE environment variable to indicate that # change, before running this script; for example: # # export TEST_GERRIT_CHANGE=219646/1 # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------# If TEST_GERRIT_CHANGE has been specified, merge that change from Gerrit.
deleted_lines: # This script can be used to bootstrap a single or multi-node # Calico/DevStack cluster. Please note that it has not been # exhaustively reviewed or tested and safety, and is designed for use # on a fresh Ubuntu Trusty VM, with no data that you would care about # losing. We recommend that you review the following code, before # running the script.# If the SERVICE_HOST environment variable is already set when # ./stack.sh is run, and is _different_ from the local machine's # hostname, the networking-calico DevStack plugin will interpret that # as a request to set up a compute-only node, that points to # $SERVICE_HOST as its controller.# On the other hand, if SERVICE_HOST is not set, or is the _same_ as # the local hostname, the plugin will set up a combined controller and # compute node.# Therefore, to bring up a multi-node Calico/DevStack cluster, set and # export SERVICE_HOST in the environment, to the hostname for the chosen # controller node in your cluster, before invoking this script.# For a single node Calico/DevStack cluster, the environment should # leave SERVICE_HOST unset. #------------------------------------------------------------------------------# If you want to test a networking-calico change in Gerrit that hasn't # yet been merged to master, set the TEST_GERRIT_CHANGE environment # variable to indicate that change, before running this script; for # example: # # export TEST_GERRIT_CHANGE=219646/1 #

subject: Add API extension for reporting IP availability usage statistics
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-14 03:25:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/272c3ccb12e463050eb22526b8e4551f80231050', 'message': "Add API extension for reporting IP address usage statistics

Implements an API extension for reporting usage statistcis of IP
addresses on Neutron networks/subnets.  This implements the spec
proposed at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/180803/

This provides an easy way for operators to count the number of
used and total IP addresses on any or all networks and/or
subnets.  Many operators have a requirement for this usage data
in order to make scheduling decisions, monitoring, triggers
for scaling, etc.

After discussions at the Neutron mid-cycle meeting in June 2015,
it was suggested this extension may be accepted in-tree without
a spec.  So here it is.

This is a direct patch of the extension we've been using internally
at Go Daddy since Icehouse.  We currently have it running in Kilo,
and not specifically tested in Liberty (other than the CI tests
in this review.)

Development credit goes to David Bingham and Craig Jellick.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Change-Id: I81406054d46b2c0e0ffcd56e898e329f943ba46f

commit_message:
Add API extension for reporting IP availability usage statistics

Implements an API extension for reporting availibility of IP
addresses on Neutron networks/subnets based on the blueprint
proposed at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/180803/

This provides an easy way for operators to count the number of
used and total IP addresses on any or all networks and/or
subnets.

Co-Authored-By: David Bingham <dbingham@godaddy.com>
Co-Authored-By: Craig Jellick <craig.jellick@gmail.com>

APIImpact
DocImpact: As a new API, will need all new docs. See devref for details.

Implements: blueprint network-ip-usage-api
Closes-Bug: 1457986
Change-Id: I81406054d46b2c0e0ffcd56e898e329f943ba46f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/55/212955/20 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2014 GoDaddy. # All Rights Reserved. # # @author: Craig Jellick, GoDaddy # @author: David Bingham, GoDaddy # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. from neutron.api import extensions as api_ext from neutron.common import config import neutron.extensions from neutron.services.network_ip_usage.plugin import IpUsagePlugin from neutron.tests.unit.db import test_db_base_plugin_v2 API_RESOURCE = 'network-ip-usages' USAGES_KEY = 'network_ip_usages' extensions_path = ':'.join(neutron.extensions.__path__) class TestNetworkIPUsageAPI(test_db_base_plugin_v2.NeutronDbPluginV2TestCase): def setUp(self): svc_plugins = { 'plugin_name': 'neutron.services.network_ip_usage.plugin' '.IpUsagePlugin'} super(TestNetworkIPUsageAPI, self).setUp(service_plugins=svc_plugins) self.plugin = IpUsagePlugin() ext_mgr = api_ext.PluginAwareExtensionManager( extensions_path, {"network-ip-usage": self.plugin} ) app = config.load_paste_app('extensions_test_app') self.ext_api = api_ext.ExtensionMiddleware(app, ext_mgr=ext_mgr) def _validate_usage(self, network, usage, expected_used_ips): self.assertEqual(network['name'], usage['name']) self.assertEqual(network['id'], usage['id']) self.assertEqual(expected_used_ips, usage['used_ips']) self.assertEqual(253, usage['total_ips']) def test_network_ip_usages(self): with self.network() as net: with self.subnet(network=net) as subnet: network = net['network'] request = self.new_list_request(API_RESOURCE) response = self.deserialize(self.fmt, request.get_response(self.ext_api)) self.assertTrue(USAGES_KEY in response) self.assertEqual(1, len(response[USAGES_KEY])) usage = response[USAGES_KEY][0] self._validate_usage(network, usage, 0) with self.port(subnet=subnet): resp2 = self.deserialize(self.fmt, request.get_response( self.ext_api)) usage_after_port = resp2[USAGES_KEY][0] self._validate_usage(network, usage_after_port, 1) single_req = self.new_show_request(API_RESOURCE, usage_after_port['id']) single_resp = self.deserialize(self.fmt, single_req.get_response( self.ext_api)) single_usage = single_resp['network_ip_usage'] self._validate_usage(network, single_usage, 1)

commit_message:
SMBFS: Ensure the attach/disconnect operations are synchronized

We need to make sure that those operations are synchronized so that
the share is not disconnected while we are trying to attach a disk.

This was already done previously, but the patch adding FC support
has moved the attach method to the BaseVolumeDriver.

This change fixes this issue. Also, the decorator used for
synchronizing the operations based on the share path has been moved
to the SMBFS volume driver, as it's strictly related to it.

Change-Id: Ia840741f4fcde5e5d56020b7ee7068833095fa4c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/compute-hyperv refs/changes/27/294027/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def export_path_synchronized(f): def wrapper(inst, connection_info, *args, **kwargs): export_path = inst._get_export_path(connection_info) @utils.synchronized(export_path) def inner(): return f(inst, connection_info, *args, **kwargs) return inner() return wrapper @export_path_synchronized def attach_volume(self, connection_info, instance_name, disk_bus=constants.CTRL_TYPE_SCSI): super(SMBFSVolumeDriver, self).attach_volume( connection_info, instance_name, disk_bus) @export_path_synchronized def disconnect_volume(self, connection_info): # We synchronize share unmount and volume attach operations based on # the share path in order to avoid the situation when a SMB share is # unmounted while a volume exported by it is about to be attached to # an instance. self._smbutils.unmount_smb_share(export_path)
deleted_lines: def export_path_synchronized(f): def wrapper(inst, connection_info, *args, **kwargs): export_path = inst._get_export_path(connection_info) @utils.synchronized(export_path) def inner(): return f(inst, connection_info, *args, **kwargs) return inner() return wrapper def disconnect_volume(self, connection_info): self._unmount_smb_share(export_path) def _unmount_smb_share(self, export_path): # We synchronize share unmount and volume attach operations based on # the share path in order to avoid the situation when a SMB share is # unmounted while a volume exported by it is about to be attached to # an instance. @utils.synchronized(export_path) def unmount_synchronized(): self._smbutils.unmount_smb_share(export_path) unmount_synchronized()

commit_message:
switch to post-versioning

This change removes the version entry from setup.cfg, relying on pbr to
derive the version number from the git tags. This post-versioning model
brings os-win in line with the other official OpenStack projects, and
avoids the need to submit separate patches to "bump" the version number
before and after a release.

Change-Id: I6d6976bc6cd1edd70864d9b2a1a8a3330b4bfcdb
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-win refs/changes/19/295019/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add --filter to "alarm list"

As we disscussed in mailing list and agreed finally, we should add
--filter and --query to "alarm list" and drop "alarm search". This change
add --filter to "alarm list".

Change-Id: I4689c03aca84633da063cef7c1ef1816780da4fe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-aodhclient refs/changes/33/292233/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_list_with_filters(self, mock_am): am = alarm.AlarmManager(self.client) filters = dict(type='threshold', severity='low') am.list(filters=filters) url = 'v2/alarms' filters_url = ("q.field=type&q.op=eq&q.value=threshold&q.field=" "severity&q.op=eq&q.value=low") expected_url = '?'.join([url, filters_url]) mock_am.assert_called_with(expected_url) @mock.patch.object(alarm.AlarmManager, '_get')

commit_message:
config options: Remove 'wsgi_' prefix from opts

Now that the WSGI opts have been added to a group, there's no longer
any reason to keep the 'wsgi_' prefix for some of these opts around.
Remove it, ensuring the old names are stored as deprecated names.

Change-Id: If39bed3ed2335b6f96455870f1a47cb868d21f39

commit_message:
trivial: Fix alignment of wsgi options

We're not using Hungarian notation so there's no need to add an
'_opt' suffix on opts. Remove this.

Change-Id: I354d1398f1da30c0d9bb9739cfab74fe397bb042

commit_message:
Merge the verify scripts

Because of the limitation of external network, merge the north-south verify
script to one file.

Change-Id: Ie0bf8ec0d100ad42197190698517f532ed0a5ede
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tricircle refs/changes/81/295781/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash # # Script name: verify_top_install.sh # This script is to verify the installation of Tricircle in Top OpenStack. # # In this script, there are some parameters you need to consider before running it. # # 1, Post URL whether is 127.0.0.1 or something else, # 2, This script create a subnet called net1 10.0.0.0/24, Change these if needed. # # Change the parameters according to your own environment. # Execute "verify_top_install.sh" in the top OpenStack # # Author: Pengfei Shi <shipengfei92@gmail.com> # set -o xtrace TEST_DIR=$(pwd) echo "Test work directory is $TEST_DIR." if [ ! -r admin-openrc.sh ];then set -o xtrace echo "Your work directory doesn't have admin-openrc.sh," echo "Please check whether you are in tricircle/devstack/ or not and run this script." exit 1 fi echo "Begining the verify testing..." echo "Import client environment variables:" source $TEST_DIR/admin-openrc.sh echo "******************************" echo "* Verify Endpoint *" echo "******************************" echo "List openstack endpoint:" openstack --debug endpoint list token=$(openstack token issue | awk 'NR==5 {print $4}') echo $token curl -X POST http://127.0.0.1:19999/v1.0/pods -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ -H "X-Auth-Token: $token" -d '{"pod": {"pod_name": "RegionOne"}}' curl -X POST http://127.0.0.1:19999/v1.0/pods -H "Content-Type: application/json" \ -H "X-Auth-Token: $token" -d '{"pod": {"pod_name": "Pod1", "az_name": "az1"}}' echo "******************************" echo "* Verify Nova *" echo "******************************" echo "Show nova aggregate:" nova --debug aggregate-list echo "Create test flavor:" nova --debug flavor-create test 1 1024 10 1 echo "******************************" echo "* Verify Neutron *" echo "******************************" echo "Create net1:" neutron --debug net-create net1 echo "Create subnet of net1:" neutron --debug subnet-create net1 10.0.0.0/24 image_id=$(glance image-list |awk 'NR==4 {print $2}') net_id=$(neutron net-list|grep net1 |awk '{print $2}') echo "Boot vm1 in az1:" nova --debug boot --flavor 1 --image $image_id --nic net-id=$net_id --availability-zone az1 vm1 echo "******************************" echo "* Verify Cinder *" echo "******************************" echo "Create a volume in az1:" cinder --debug create --availability-zone=az1 1 echo "Show volume list:" cinder --debug list volume_id=$(cinder list |grep lvmdriver-1 | awk '{print $2}') echo "Show detailed volume info:" cinder --debug show $volume_id echo "Delete test volume:" cinder --debug delete $volume_id cinder --debug list

With multi-backend deployments it was very hard to follow which backend

commit_message:
Add backend id to Pure Volume Driver trace logs

With multi-backend deployments it was very hard to follow which backend
was making which calls. When there was an error it was often unhelpful
to look at the tracing to know which backend had the problem.

This will now print out the active backend id with the tracing log
messages.

Change-Id: Iaa1ec1c9027f6ba8aeb2574b92a416ae4bd86455
Closes-Bug: #1552966

subject: Fix Aodh-alarm-evaluator recreates deleted alarms in some cases
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-10 03:50:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/aodh/commit/6fda4bece2fabe851d13539dc2a4b83a86113484', 'message': 'Fix Alarm-valuator recreat deleted alarms in some cases

When Aodh using sqlalchemy as the datastore backend,
session.merge is used to update an alarm object,
which has a behavior of create if not exist.

Modify it to session.query.

Change-Id: I1f940a0a90a7ee4c85ce0460edf5985be24d1e1c

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-10 10:01:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/aodh/commit/db8be8767cf74fa09ba4a2570081e6f70ceb2850', 'message': 'Fix Aodh-alarm-evaluator recreates deleted alarms in some cases

When Aodh if using sqlalchemy as the datastore backend,
session.merge is used to update an alarm object,
which has the behavior of creating the object if it does not exist.

Modify it to session.query.

Change-Id: I1f940a0a90a7ee4c85ce0460edf5985be24d1e1c
Closes-Bug: #1553976

When Aodh uses sqlalchemy as the datastore backend,

commit_message:
Fix Aodh-alarm-evaluator recreates deleted alarms in some cases

When Aodh uses sqlalchemy as the datastore backend,
session.merge is used to update an alarm object,
which has the behavior of creating the object if it does not exist.

Modify it to session.query.

Co-Authored-By: liusheng <liusheng@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I1f940a0a90a7ee4c85ce0460edf5985be24d1e1c
Closes-Bug: #1553976
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/aodh refs/changes/64/290964/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: alarm_row = session.query(models.Alarm).get(alarm.alarm_id)
deleted_lines: alarm_row = session.merge(models.Alarm(alarm_id=alarm.alarm_id))

commit_message:
Added support for an hybrid gnocchi storage

This storage removes the need to duplicate the data present in gnocchi.
Every dataframe is associated to the metric_id that generated the
calculations.
The downside is that you can only use gnocchi with this storage driver.
Moved around some utility function to remove the need to duplicate code
and have a cleaner boundary between the different parts of the code.

Change-Id: Iabfdcd4c15c906ed145ce383b65d1538f72671aa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty refs/changes/56/246856/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- # Copyright 2015 Objectif Libre # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # @author: Stéphane Albert # import decimal import json from oslo_db.sqlalchemy import utils from oslo_log import log import sqlalchemy from cloudkitty import db from cloudkitty import storage from cloudkitty.storage.gnocchi_hybrid import migration from cloudkitty.storage.gnocchi_hybrid import models from cloudkitty.storage import sqlalchemy as sql_storage from cloudkitty import utils as ck_utils LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) class GnocchiHybridStorage(sql_storage.SQLAlchemyStorage): """Gnocchi Hybrid Storage Backend Driver used to add support for gnocchi until the creation of custom resources is supported in gnocchi. """ frame_model = models.HybridRatedDataframe @staticmethod def init(): migration.upgrade('head') def _append_time_frame(self, res_type, frame, tenant_id): rating_dict = frame.get('rating', {}) rate = rating_dict.get('price') if not rate: rate = decimal.Decimal(0) metric_ref = frame.get('metric_id') if not metric_ref: LOG.warn('Trying to store data collected outside of gnocchi. ' 'This driver can only be used with the gnocchi collector. ' 'Data not stored!') self.add_time_frame(begin=self.usage_start_dt.get(tenant_id), end=self.usage_end_dt.get(tenant_id), tenant_id=tenant_id, res_type=res_type, metric_ref=metric_ref, rate=rate) def add_time_frame(self, **kwargs): """Create a new time frame. :param begin: Start of the dataframe. :param end: End of the dataframe. :param res_type: Type of the resource. :param rate: Calculated rate for this dataframe. :param tenant_id: tenant_id of the dataframe owner. :param metric_ref: Reference to the gnocchi metric (UUID). """ super(GnocchiHybridStorage, self).add_time_frame(**kwargs)

commit_message:
Downgrade "device not found" log message

This message is a normal occurence when an agent requests
details about a port that was just deleted. It's not a
warning condition that the operator can take any action on
so this patch downgrades it to debug.

Change-Id: I4c19993f03bf4d417bff2d3d45bb40b1b732650d
Closes-Bug: #1554696
(cherry picked from commit cb7e70497f68c295080add6c739743e6ea81e824)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/02/296502/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.debug("Device %(device)s requested by agent " "%(agent_id)s not found in database", {'device': device, 'agent_id': agent_id})
deleted_lines: LOG.warning(_LW("Device %(device)s requested by agent " "%(agent_id)s not found in database"), {'device': device, 'agent_id': agent_id})

subject: Resolve oslo_config deprecations in nova.conf

Each of the following log messages are resolved by these changes:

* Option "auth_plugin" from group "keystone_authtoken" is deprecated.

* Option "host" from group "glance" is deprecated for removal.
* Option "port" from group "glance" is deprecated for removal.

Under the [glance] group the use of api_servers in all cases is the

'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-24 21:51:01.000000000', 'files': ['templates/nova.conf.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova/commit/a2c215b6e71936cefd03f56ff3ff7f96389aea69', 'message': 'Resolve oslo_config deprecations in nova.conf

Each of the following log messages are resolved by these changes:

* Option "auth_plugin" from group "keystone_authtoken" is deprecated.
Use option "auth_type" from group "keystone_authtoken".
* Option "use_local" from group "conductor" is deprecated for removal.
* Option "host" from group "glance" is deprecated for removal.
* Option "port" from group "glance" is deprecated for removal.

Under the [glance] group the use of api_servers in all cases is the
current recommendation per related change-id. As a result, the
glance_host and glance_service_port variables which were used to
define the deprecated configuration values are used to construct an
api_servers value that is backwards-compatible.

The glance_host variable is already provided by the OpenStack-Ansible
playbook to install nova so no new required role vars are introduced.
The glance_host var is not renamed to begin with the nova_ namespace
prefix at this time. That change should be introduced in a following
patch.

The following message is not addressed:
* Option "username" from group "keystone_authtoken" is deprecated.
Use option "user-name" from group "keystone_authtoken".

This is a bogus warning, There is no support for use of user-name
in the keystone auth library.

Related-To: I8c973e9f325f5b732d827a702a98eff8ca56cbd7
Change-Id: I8697775ccc77c11b4ed2735f40eaf3c68975a16c
'}]
commit_message:
Resolve oslo_config deprecations in nova.conf

Each of the following log messages are resolved by these changes:

* Option "auth_plugin" from group "keystone_authtoken" is deprecated.
Use option "auth_type" from group "keystone_authtoken".
* Option "use_local" from group "conductor" is deprecated for removal.
* Option "host" from group "glance" is deprecated for removal.
* Option "port" from group "glance" is deprecated for removal.

Under the [glance] group the use of api_servers in all cases is the
current recommendation per related change-id. As a result, the
glance_host and glance_service_port variables which were used to
define the deprecated configuration values are used to construct an
api_servers value that is backwards-compatible.

The glance_host variable is already provided by the OpenStack-Ansible
playbook to install nova so no new required role vars are introduced.
The glance_host var is not renamed to begin with the nova_ namespace
prefix at this time. That change should be introduced in a following
patch.

The following message is not addressed:
* Option "username" from group "keystone_authtoken" is deprecated.
Use option "user-name" from group "keystone_authtoken".

This is a bogus warning, There is no support for use of user-name
in the keystone auth library.

Related-To: I8c973e9f325f5b732d827a702a98eff8ca56cbd7
Change-Id: I8697775ccc77c11b4ed2735f40eaf3c68975a16c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova refs/changes/34/290834/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: auth_type = passworduser-name = {{ neutron_service_user_name }}
deleted_lines: {% else %} host = {{ glance_host }} port = {{ glance_service_port }}auth_plugin = passwordusername = {{ neutron_service_user_name }}use_local = false

commit_message:
Added gnocchi collector

CloudKitty now supports gnocchi data collection.
Support is still experimental as it's lacking some data.
Some fetched data might be inaccurate as it highly depend on your
archive policies.

Change-Id: I7e6668c766b7bd4641cccc2bd841a7aed1d2e2d5

commit_message:
Implement initial test inventory/plays

This patch implements an initial set of inventory and playbooks
which results in the successful convergence of a standalone
build of Ironic.

It also adds the rootwrap filters, implement config_template
for all the conf files appropriately and ensures that the sudoers
is implemented in the right order of execution.

All content is based from the head of stable/mitaka on
24 Mar 2016.

Change-Id: I9182951c394a8c52826480aba7bc7e4d437988c5

commit_message:
Correct _populate_default_domain in tests

The comment here said that the default domain is created by a
migration, but it's not.

Change-Id: Ifbf2615f330c2a78221033c7d465d49450a2ec9e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/79/297879/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: self.resource_api.get_domain(DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID) except exception.DomainNotFound: domain = unit.new_domain_ref( description=(u'The default domain'), id=DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, name=u'Default') self.resource_api.create_domain(DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, domain)
deleted_lines: if CONF.database.connection == unit.IN_MEM_DB_CONN_STRING: # NOTE(morganfainberg): If an in-memory db is being used, be sure # to populate the default domain, this is typically done by # a migration, but the in-mem db uses model definitions to create # the schema (no migrations are run). try: self.resource_api.get_domain(DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID) except exception.DomainNotFound: domain = unit.new_domain_ref( description=(u'The default domain'), id=DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, name=u'Default') self.resource_api.create_domain(DEFAULT_DOMAIN_ID, domain)

commit_message:
Translations: use neutron._18n instead of neutron.18n

The neutron.18n import will be deprecated. In addition to this
this removes deprecation warnings.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I3daf14fe317e28c18d00af56f4f4e4a41d103361

subject: Stop engine service correctly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-25 16:39:08.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/service.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/151e8b8e62a508f07e4a67bee2418e4965c59944', 'message': 'Stop engine service correctly

If SIGINT received right after start of heat engine, in the middle
of start() method, heat engine can not stop correctly. Clean up only
those resources that actually exist.

Change-Id: I496f6284e15b4f71b166cc0713cfd41423cce400
Closes-Bug: #1562042
'}]
commit_message:
Stop engine service correctly

If SIGINT received right after start of heat engine, in the middle
of start() method, heat engine can not stop correctly. Clean up only
those resources that actually exist.

Change-Id: I496f6284e15b4f71b166cc0713cfd41423cce400
Closes-Bug: #1562042
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/56/297756/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if self._rpc_server is None: return if self.thread_group_mgr: for stack_id in list(self.thread_group_mgr.groups.keys()): # Ignore dummy service task if stack_id == cfg.CONF.periodic_interval: continue LOG.info(_LI("Waiting stack %s processing to be finished"), stack_id) # Stop threads gracefully self.thread_group_mgr.stop(stack_id, True) LOG.info(_LI("Stack %s processing was finished"), stack_id) if self.manage_thread_grp: self.manage_thread_grp.stop() ctxt = context.get_admin_context() service_objects.Service.delete(ctxt, self.service_id) LOG.info(_LI('Service %s is deleted'), self.service_id)
deleted_lines: for stack_id in list(self.thread_group_mgr.groups.keys()): # Ignore dummy service task if stack_id == cfg.CONF.periodic_interval: continue LOG.info(_LI("Waiting stack %s processing to be finished"), stack_id) # Stop threads gracefully self.thread_group_mgr.stop(stack_id, True) LOG.info(_LI("Stack %s processing was finished"), stack_id) self.manage_thread_grp.stop() ctxt = context.get_admin_context() service_objects.Service.delete(ctxt, self.service_id) LOG.info(_LI('Service %s is deleted'), self.service_id)
